disease: Other infectious mononucleosis with other complication

symptoms.name: Fatigue
symptoms.severity: Variable, may persist for weeks or months

symptoms.name: Pharyngitis
symptoms.severity: Variable, may be severe, painful, and exudative

symptoms.name: Lymphadenopathy
symptoms.severity: Variable, may be the only manifestation
symptoms.pattern: Usually symmetric, may involve any group of nodes

symptoms.name: Splenomegaly
symptoms.severity: Present in about 50% of cases, maximal during 2nd and 3rd week
symptoms.pattern: Usually only barely palpable splenic tip

physical_findings: Mild hepatomegaly and hepatic percussion tenderness

lab_values.complete blood count: Lymphocytes that are morphologically atypical account for up to 30% of the white blood cells
lab_values.liver function tests: Elevated aminotransferase levels (about 2 to 3 times normal, returning to baseline over 3 to 4 weeks); occur in about 90% of patients

risk_factors: Immunocompromised state (e.g., organ transplant recipients, HIV-positive individuals)

required: Typical symptoms and signs (fever, pharyngitis, lymphadenopathy, hepatosplenomegaly)
supportive: Atypical lymphocytosis on complete blood count
